Awesome video as always Nile. Quick question, if I went the route without the soxhlet extractor, and used the iso and glove boiling, would it be better if I refluxed the solution using idk say a allihn condenser and reflux the solution, or would just boiling the gloves in the isopropanol be a better way of doing it? For anyone thats running this synthesis, if you instead use just 100mL IPA in the soxhlet extractor (instead of the 250mL), and also dissolve the NaOH in just 100mL of H2O (instead of 250mL), then you will get more phthalic acid crystals, some will crystalize out of solution before you even put it in the freezer. Just a suggestion.
I followed the steps listed here almost exactly, and while it worked ok, I had to boil off a lot of the solution to get a decent return of phthalic acid crystals. Just using less IPA and H2O made a world of difference.

SUCCESS!  I picked up a 10 pack of "Mr. Clean" brand gloves at Dollar General.  Weight was 41.19g.  I did this in three days.  First day, extraction.  Second day, NaOH and reflux.  Excellent phase separation.  Put in freezer overnight.  Day three, did sublimation, not quite a gram, but at least it worked!  PS-used 1L flask in mantle/stirrer from Cynmar; nice units.

Phthalic acid can also be produced by simmering naphthalene (mothballs) with potassium permanganate in a small quantity of acidified water.  The reaction also produces phthalonic acid (C6H4(COOH)((CO)COOH)), which oxidizes to phthalic acid.
See, e.g., Thomas E. Thorpe, A Dictionary of Applied Chemistry (1916), vol. 3, p. 561, and the 1894 patent of Joseph Tscherniac, German patent no. 79693.

FYI: Vinyl gloves from Rite Aid Rx will not work.  I got through fine, and after three hours, the refluxed liquid was yellow.  Six hours later, there was no phase separation, thus the conclusion.  Also, don't waste money on one of those $130.00 heat/stir units with the blue front panel.  They will burn up regardless of what the manual says about cutoff, etc.  Go for a better commercial unit!
